Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {andorra}
Author: Gov. of Andorra
source_population: The population number is as stated in the \citet{royo2021mass} which is the published article reporting on the study.
source_deathsdata: For \citet{andorra}, we obtained mortality numbers from the Government of Andorra (\url{https://www.govern.ad/coronavirus}; accessed on June 28, 2021) as tabulated by Wikipedia (\url{https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Andorra}; accessed on June 28, 2021).
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from \url{https://www.indexmundi.com/andorra/demographics_profile.html} (accessed on June 28, 2021)
source_GDPdata: GDP data is from The World Factbook (\url{https://statisticstimes.com/economy/countries-by-gdp-capita-ppp.php}; accessed on June 28, 2021)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {petersen2020seroprevalence}
Author: Petersen et al.
source_population: Population value is from \citet{petersen2020seroprevalence} (``In the Faroe Islands, a geographic isolate of 52,154 inhabitants.'').
source_deathsdata: For \citet{petersen2020seroprevalence}, information on deaths for the Faroe Islands was obtained from \url{corona.fo/hagtol}, the government information website concerning COVID19 in the Faroe Islands.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from Index mundi (see \url{https://tinyurl.com/bb2pwrx6}; accessed on April 29, 2021) which cites the CIA World Factbook as a source.
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Denmark from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {warszawski}
Author: Warszawski et al.
source_population: Population data is from INSEE in report titled ``Population totale par sexe et âge au 1er janvier 2020, France métropolitaine'' (see \url{https://www.insee.fr/fr/statistiques/1892088?sommaire=1912926}; accessed August 4, 2021).  We subtract 611,000 to account for those living in long term-care facilities (EHPAD) (see \url{https://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2020/12/02/le-besoin-de-places-en-ehpad-va-devenir-massif-d-ici-a-2030_6061915_3224.html}; accessed August 4, 2021) since the serostudy (and the mortality data) specificaly apply to ``Individuals aged 15 years or above, residing in metropolitan France, excluding EHPADs, retirement homes and prisons.''
source_deathsdata: We obtained mortality data from the French government COVID-19 dashboard (see \url{https://dashboard.covid19.data.gouv.fr/vue-d-ensemble?location=FRA}; accessed on August 4, 2021), summing up the cumulative deaths for the 13 regions of Metropolitain France (i.e., European France). (235+394+1616+407+471+6710+3256+959+371+1562+469+836+56 and 257+427+1804+461+528+7358+3518+1032+411+1721+508+927+59).  Note that this death total does not include deaths that occurred in long term care facilities (``EHPAD et EMS'').
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is for France from 2019 as listed by World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (\url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS?locations=FR}; accessed August 4, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for France from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26))

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {santos2020serology}
Author: Santos-Hovener et al.
source_population: Population value is from Wikipedia (\url{https://als.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kupferzell}; accessed July 30, 2021) which cites the Statistisches Landesamt Baden-Württemberg – Bevölkerung nach Nationalität und Geschlecht am 31. Dezember 2019 (CSV-Datei).
source_deathsdata: For \citet{santos2020serology}, data for the number of deaths for Kupferzell, Germany was obtained directly from \citet{santos2020serology} (citing the Robert Koch Institute) which suggested that (in Figure 1) no more than 3 deaths occured in the town for the period before July, 2020.  Despite efforts, no publicly available dataset was found which could confirm these numbers specific these numbers.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from: \url{https://ugeo.urbistat.com/AdminStat/en/de/demografia/eta/kupferzell/20172564/4} (accessed on April 29, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Germany from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {streeck2020infection}
Author: Streeck et al.
source_population: Streeck et al.: "In the German community of Gangelt (12,597 inhabitants, January 1, 2020)"
source_deathsdata: For \citet{streeck2020infection}, the number of deaths for Gangelt, Kreis Heinsberg, Germany, is directly noted in the \citet{streeck2020infection} article.  No publicly available dataset was found, however we did find information on the Gangelt municipal bulletin (see \url{www.gangelt.de/news/226-erster-corona-fall-in-nrw}; accessed on April 28, 2021) and an investigative report (see \url{https://medwatch.de/2020/11/26/die-ungezaehlten-todesfaelle-aus-gangelt/}; accessed on May 20, 2021) which suggests that 8 to 10 as a reasonable range.  Note that the seroprevalence estimates for this study are based on the results of antibody tests as well as the results of PCR tests.   As such the 14 day offset may not be as appropriate for this study as compared to other studies that consider only antibody tests.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from Figure S1 of \citet{streeck2020infection}.
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Germany from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {radon2020protocol}
Author: Radon et al.
source_deathsdata: The number of deaths was obtained from the official database of the city of Munich (https://www.muenchen.de/rathaus/Stadtinfos/Coronavirus-Fallzahlen.html; accessed June 22, 2021).
source_aged65data: https://www.muenchen.de/rathaus/dam/jcr:459cce24-3894-4d4d-b144-4185b750a310/LHM.Stat_Faltkarte_2019_englisch.pdf
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Germany from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {murhekar2020prevalence}
Author: Murhekar et al. (1)
source_population: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.TOTL?locations=IN
source_deathsdata: For \citet{murhekar2020prevalence}, we obtained the number of cumulative deaths for India, from the Our World in Data COVID-19 dataset available at: \url{ourworldindata.org/coronavirus/country/india}  (accessed on April 28, 2021).   We multiplied the number recorded for 14 days after the end of the sampling window of 12,573 by a factor of 3.64 (based on the upper bound of \citet{purkayastha2021estimating}'s estimated underreporting factor for India (first wave))  in order to account for potential underreporting.  As such, our interval is relatively wide and reflects the uncertainty in the true number of deaths: [4,172, 45766].  (\citet{purkayastha2021estimating}: "Estimates from epidemiological models: For wave 1 our estimate ... an underreporting factor for cases estimated at 11.11 (95% CrI 10.71 – 11.47) and for deaths at 3.56 (95% CrI 3.48 – 3.64).")
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS}  (last updated 2021-03-19)).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for India from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {sharma2020seroprevalence}
Author: Sharma et al.
source_population: we use 18.9 million as the estimated population of Delhi, the number cited by both Sharma et al. (2020) and Bhattacharyya et al. (2021), while Chen et al. (2021) use a much different number: 30,290,936 (see Table S14 in Supplementary appendix 2 of Chen et al. (2021)).
source_deathsdata: Data for the number of deaths for Delhi was obtained from Wikipedia (\url{en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Delhi}; accessed on April 28, 2021) which sourced the information from the Delhi State Health Bulletin (\url{https://delhifightscorona.in/}).  We multiplied the number recorded for 14 days after the end of the sampling window of 4,270 by a factor of 6.3 (based on  the upper bound of \citet{mukherjee2021estimating}'s estimated underreporting factor) in order to account for potential underreporting.  As such, our interval is relatively wide and reflects the uncertainty in the true number of deaths: [4,188, 26,901].
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from Statistics Times for 2011  (\url{http://statisticstimes.com/demographics/india/delhi-population.php}; accessed on April 29, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for India from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).  Note that we use 18.9 million as the estimated population of Delhi, the number cited by both \citet{sharma2020seroprevalence} and \citet{bhattacharyya2021incorporating}, while \citet{chen2021serological} use a much different number: 30,290,936 (see Table S14 in Supplementary appendix 2 of \citet{chen2021serological}).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {kar2021prevalence}
Author: Kar et al.
source_population: Population for Puducherry District from \citet{kar2021prevalence} who note that: ``Puducherry district, population ≈1.25 million, is located in southern India.''
source_deathsdata: For \citet{kar2021prevalence}, data for the number of deaths for Puducherry District was obtained from \url{https://covid19dashboard.py.gov.in/Reporting/District} (accessed on August 5, 2021).   We multiplied the number recorded for 14 days after the end of the sampling window by a factor of 2.1 (based on the upper bound of \citet{mukherjee2021estimating}'s estimated underreporting factor for Puducherry) in order to account for potential underreporting.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from \url{http://statisticstimes.com/demographics/india/puducherry-population.php} (accessed on June 22, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for India from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {malani2021seroprevalence}
Author: Malani et al.
source_population: https://www.indiacensus.net/states/tamil-nadu
source_deathsdata: Mortality data for the number of deaths for Tamil Nadu obtained from the Tamil Nadu Government (see https://stopcorona.tn.gov.in/archive/; accessed June 24, 2021). We multiplied the number recorded for 14 days after the end of the sampling window of 11909 by a factor of 2.5 (based on the upper bound of \citet{mukherjee2021estimating}'s estimated underreporting factor for Tamil Nadu).
source_aged65data: https://statisticstimes.com/demographics/india/tamil-nadu-population.php
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for India from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {selvaraju2021population}
Author: Selvaraju et al.
source_population: https://www.populationu.com/cities/chennai-population
source_deathsdata: Mortality data for the number of deaths for Chennai obtained from the Greater Chennai Corporation (see http://covid19.chennaicorporation.gov.in/; specifically, numbers published for July 15, 2020 and August 14, 2020 were listed at: https://twitter.com/chennaicorp/status/1283280173132128259 and https://twitter.com/chennaicorp/status/1294140456868052993).  We multiplied the number recorded for 14 days after the end of the sampling window of 2384 by a factor of 2.5 (based the upper bound of \citet{mukherjee2021estimating}'s estimated underreporting factor for Tamil Nadu) in order to account for potential underreporting.
source_aged65data: https://statisticstimes.com/demographics/india/tamil-nadu-population.php
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for India from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {khalagi2021prevalence}
Author: Khalagi et al.
source_population: Population value from https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.TOTL?locations=IR.
source_deathsdata: For \citet{khalagi2021prevalence}, \citet{kobak2021excess} suggest that official mortality data for Iran is highly inaccurate and suggest that there have been approx. 58,092 excess deaths in Iran for the period until Sept. 21, 2020.  This coincides with the estimate provided by {ghafari2020excess} of 58,900 (95\% CI 46,900 - 69,500) for the period from December 22, 2019 to September 21, 2020.  Excess mortality data is only available in quarterly format from \citet{kobak2021excess}.  Therefore it is not possible to obtain mortality data for the specific dates we require: 2020-08-17 and 2020-11-14.  Official statistics for these dates are 19,804 and 41,034 (see \url{https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Iran}; accessed on June 28, 2021, which cites the Iranian Ministry of Health and Medical Education).  Multiplying these numbers by \citet{kobak2021excess}'s estimated undercount ratio of 2.4 gives: 47332 and 98071.  (see \url{https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7852240/pdf/nihpp-2021.01.27.21250604v3.pdf}; accessed on June 28, 2021).
source_aged65data: Data for the population and the proportion of the population aged over 65 is from the World Bank World Development Indicators  (WDI) data (\url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS?locations=IR};  accessed on June 28, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Iran, Islamic Rep. from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {israel}
Author: MoHoI
source_population: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.TOTL?locations=IL
source_deathsdata: Mortality data is from Wikipedia (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Israel; accessed on August6, 2021)  which references: Israel's Ministry of Health official coronavirus updates Telegram channel, and Israel's Corona National Information and Knowledge Center.
source_aged65data: https://brookdale.jdc.org.il/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/MJB-Facts_and_Figures_Elderly-65_in_Israel-2018_English.pdf
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Israel from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {melotti2021prevalence}
Author: Melotti et al.
source_population: the report "Study on the prevalence of Covid-19 in the Val Gardena - June 2020" (https://astat.provincia.bz.it/it/news-pubblicazioni-info.asp?news_action=300&news_image_id=1074603)
source_deathsdata: In the report "Study on the prevalence of Covid-19 in the Val Gardena - June 2020" (https://astat.provincia.bz.it/it/news-pubblicazioni-info.asp?news_action=300&news_image_id=1074603), it is noted that "the number of deaths from this disease in 17 people...".   Stefano Lombardo (stefano.lombardo@provincia.bz.it)  notes that the source of this number is Astat, Bolzano ("statistics on deaths by cause").
source_aged65data: The study looks specifically at three municipalities (Ortisei, Santa Cristina, and Selva) and we have found age data on these from: https://www.citypopulation.de/en/italy/trentinoaltoadige/bolzano/021089__selva_di_val_gardena/  and and http://italia.indettaglio.it/eng/trentinoaltoadige/ortisei.html.
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Italy from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {pagani2021prevalence}
Author: Pagani et al.
source_population: The paper states: "Castiglione d’Adda (CdA) is a town of 4605 inhabitants (according to data from the local registry office at the time of our study)...".
source_deathsdata: The paper does not cite a specific source for deaths but notes: "From the 1st of January to the 31st of March 2020, 76 deaths (1.65% of the population) have been recorded in CdA, of which 47 were officially attributed to COVID-19."  Harlan has emailed gabriele.pagani@unimi.it for more details.
source_aged65data: https://www.citypopulation.de/en/italy/localities/lombardia/lodi/09801410001__castiglione_dadda/
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Italy from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {yoshiyama2021prevalence}
Author: Yoshiyama et al.
source_population: https://www.metro.tokyo.lg.jp/tosei/hodohappyo/press/2021/01/28/01.html
source_deathsdata: \citet{kobak2021excess} do not suggest that official Japanese numbers are inacurate.  Therefore, for the number of deaths for "2020-06-15" and "2020-06-21", we used official numbers from the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour, and Welfare (see \url{https://www.mhlw.go.jp/content/10906000/000640012.pdf} and \url{https://www.mhlw.go.jp/content/10906000/000641965.pdf}; accessed August 6, 2021).
source_aged65data: https://www.metro.tokyo.lg.jp/ENGLISH/ABOUT/HISTORY/history03.htm
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Japan from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {nawa2020seroprevalence}
Author: Nawa et al.
source_population: Population value is from \url{https://www.city.utsunomiya.tochigi.jp/shisei/gaiyo/1007461.html} (accessed July 12th).
source_deathsdata: For \citet{nawa2020seroprevalence}, we concluded that 0 deaths had occurred based on official records for the Tochigi prefecture (see \url{https://www.nippon.com/en/japan-data/h00657/}; accessed July 12th, 2021).
source_aged65data: Data for proportion aged over 65 is from \url{https://www8.cao.go.jp/kourei/english/annualreport/2017/pdf/c1-1.pdf} (accessed July 12th, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Japan from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {vos2020nationwide}
Author: Vos et al.
source_population: Population value is from the World Bank (\url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.TOTL?locations=NL}; accessed July 30, 2021).
source_deathsdata: For \citet{vos2020nationwide}, mortality data for the Netherlands was obtained from the Our World in Data COVID-19 dataset available at: \url{ourworldindata.org/coronavirus/country/netherlands}  (accessed on April 28, 2021).
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is also from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS}  (last updated 2021-03-19)).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Netherlands from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {alvarez2021seroprevalence_lancet}
Author: Álvarez-Antonio et al.
source_population: Population data is from the published article {alvarez2021seroprevalence_lancet}.
source_deathsdata: We used official (post-audit) numbers from the Peru Ministry of Health (MINSA) (see \url{https://www.datosabiertos.gob.pe/dataset/fallecidos-por-covid-19-ministerio-de-salud-minsa/resource/4b7636f3-5f0c-4404-8526}) for mortality numbers.  We included deaths recorded for 4 districts ("SAN JUAN BAUTISTA", "BELEN", "PUNCHANA", and "IQUITOS") in the "LORETO" department.  Note however, that recording the accurate number of deaths is perhaps  particularly challenging in Iquitos see \citet{fraser2020covid}.  In order to acknoledge that there is substantial uncertainty in the post-audit mortality numbers, we widened the interval by lowering the lower bound by 10% and incresing the upper bound by 10%.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from a 2004 World Health Organization report (see \url{https://www.who.int/ageing/projects/intra/phase_two/alc_intra2_cp_peru.pdf}; accessed August 2, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Peru from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-06-21)).  However, note that \citet{alvarez2021seroprevalence_lancet} are careful to describe Iquitos as ``among Peru's poorest regions, with more than 60\% of Iquitos's population classified either as poor or extremely poor.''

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {reyes2021sars}
Author: Reyes-Vega et al.
source_population: https://www.minsa.gob.pe/reunis/data/poblacion_estimada.asp  (Note that Reyes-Vega et al. state that: "The study area has an estimated 10.7 million inhabitants")
Specific.Geography: Peru; Lima and Callao; Lima metropolitan area
source_deathsdata: https://www.datosabiertos.gob.pe/dataset/fallecidos-por-covid-19-ministerio-de-salud-minsa/resource/4b7636f3-5f0c-4404-8526 provides data.   Peru audited death records and the data was updated on May 31, 2021 (see https://www.datosabiertos.gob.pe/dataset/fallecidos-por-covid-19-ministerio-de-salud-minsa) {dyer2021covid}.  Note we sum deaths recorded for both Lima and Callao provinces. In order to acknoledge that there is substantial uncertainty in the post-audit mortality numbers, we widened the interval by lowering the lower bound by 10% and incresing the upper bound by 10%.    (code: dim(look1[look1[,"PROVINCIA"]%in%c("LIMA", "CALLAO") & look1[,"date_of_death"]<=(as.Date("2020-06-28", "%Y-%m-%d")+14),]) )
source_aged65data: https://www.citypopulation.de/en/peru/admin/15__lima/
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Peru from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-06-21)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {barchuk2020seroprevalence}
Author: Barchuk et al.
source_population: The population value is from \url{https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Petersburg} (accessed June 21, 2021)).
source_deathsdata: For \citet{barchuk2020seroprevalence}, we used excess death numbers as reported by \citet{kobak2021excess}. Russian official statistics appear to underestimate the true number of fatalities by a substantial factor \cite{karlinsky2021world}.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from \citet{barchuk2020seroprevalence} (see Table A3 ``KOUZh-2018'').
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Russian Federation from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {pollan2020prevalence}
Author: Pollan et al.
source_population: Population value is from  the World Bank for 2020 (\url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.TOTL?locations=ES}; accessed July 30, 2021).
source_deathsdata: Data for the number of deaths was obtained from Wikipedia (\url{en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain}; accessed on April 28, 2021) which sourced the information from the Centro Nacional de Epidemiología (\url{cnecovid.isciii.es/covid19/}).  Note that, the number of deaths of for 2020-05-11 of 26,920 (14 days after the start of the sampling window), is actually higher than the number of deaths for 2020-05-25 of 26,834 (14 days after the end of the sampling window).  This may be due to a reporting issue which is noted by Wikipedia: ``Figures for 2020-05-24 to 2020-06-17 include corrections in the validation of past data from several autonomous communities as a result of the transition to a new surveillance methodology implemented from 2020-05-11.''
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS}  (last updated 2021-03-19)).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Spain from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {richard2020seroprevalence}
Author: Richard et al.
source_population: Population value is from the the Swiss Federal Statistical Office (\url{https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/en/home/statistics/regional-statistics/regional-portraits-key-figures/cantons/geneva.html}; accessed July 30, 2021).
source_deathsdata: Mortality data for the canton of Geneva were obtained from an excel file made publicly available by a Swiss government website at: \url{ge.ch/document/covid-19-donnees-completes-debut-pandemie} (accessed on April 28, 2021).
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from \url{https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/en/home/statistics/regional-statistics/regional-portraits-key-figures/cantons/geneva.html}.
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Switzerland from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {ward2020declining}
Author: Ward et al.
source_population: Population value is from the Office of National Statistics report: ``Population estimates for the UK, England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland: mid-2020''' (See Table 2) (\url{https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/populationandmigration/populationestimates/bulletins/annualmidyearpopulationestimates/mid2020}; accessed July 30, 2021).
source_deathsdata:
We obtained the number of cumulative deaths for England from the PHE data series on deaths (\url{https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/924523/COVID-19_Death_Series_20201006.ods}; accessed on August 6, 2021). PHE data series on deaths notes that: "There are 2 definitions of a death in a person with COVID-19 in England, one broader measure and one measure reflecting current trends: 1) A death in a person with a laboratory-confirmed positive COVID-19 test and
either died within 60 days of the first specimen date or died more than 60 days
after the first specimen date, only if COVID-19 is mentioned on the death
certificate; 2) A death in a person with a laboratory-confirmed positive COVID-19 test and
died within (equal to or less than) 28 days of the first positive specimen date."  We use then numbers calculated from the first definition.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is for England from 2019 as listed by LG Inform (see \url{https://tinyurl.com/4vhrb2uu}; accessed on April 29, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for United Kingdom from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26))

source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from \url{https://www.indexmundi.com/jersey/demographics_profile.html} (accessed on April 29, 2021)

Author: Bajema et al.
source_population: Population is from \url{https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/fultoncountygeorgia} and \url{https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/dekalbcountygeorgia}  (accessed July 28, 2021) (i.e., 759297 + 1063937).
Specific.Geography: United States of America; Georgia; Atlanta
source_deathsdata: For \citet{bajema2020comparison}, we obtained the number of deaths for DeKalb, and Fulton counties from the county-level COVID-19 dataset curated by the New York Times available at: \url{github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data} (accessed on April 28, 2021).
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from \url{https://github.com/JieYingWu/COVID-19_US_County-level_Summaries/blob/master/data/README.md} (accessed on April 29, 2021).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {chan2021seroprevalence}
Author: Chan et al.
source_population: The population calue is obtained from \url{https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/RI} (accessed July 28, 2021).
Specific.Geography: United States of America; Rhode Island
source_deathsdata: We obtained mortality data from the Rhode Island Department of Health available at \url{https://ri-department-of-health-covid-19-data-rihealth.hub.arcgis.com/}.  Note that Chan et al. (2021) state that: " As of May 31, Rhode Island had reported 827 cumulative lab-confirmed SARS- CoV-2–involved deaths; 78.5% of  these deaths were associated with congregate care facilities. After exclusion of these deaths (and based on a 1.06 million state population), the estimated infection fatality rate corresponding to the unweighted seroprevalence of 2.1% was 7.7 per 1000 (95% CI = 3.9, 26.9); the infection fatality rate corre- sponding to the age-weighted seropre- valence of 2.9% was 5.6 per 1000 (95% CI = 2.6, 16.1)."  This suggests that the appropriate number of deaths for the target population should not include those deaths "associated with congregate care facilities".  As such we reduced the numbers for the deaths by 78.5% (=684*(1-0.785) and =877*(1-0.785)).
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from the U.S. Department of Commerce \url{https://www.census.gov/quickfacts/RI} (accessed on June 21, 2021).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for the state of Rhode Island, USA, for 2019 at \url{https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_and_territories_by_GDP_per_capita} (accessed on April 29, 2021).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {beaumont2021high}
Notes_exclusion: excluded due to lack of mortality data for the target population (three specific neighbourhoods (Saint-Jacques, Haut-Vernet, and Nouveau Logis) in the city of Perpignan, France).
Author: Beaumont et al.
Location: Three neighbourhoods in the city of Perpignan, France.

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {gegout2021seroprevalence}
Notes_exclusion: excluded due to lack of mortality data for "Grand Nancy" (however, note that "coronadatascraper.com" does have data for the larger region of Meurthe-et-Moselle, Grand Est, France.
Author: Gégout-Petit et al.

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {ramaswamy2021cross}
Notes_exclusion: While official death numbers are available for the District of Jabalpur (from the "Official Account of the Directorate of Health Services, Government of Madhya Pradesh. (e.g., \url{https://twitter.com/healthminmp/status/1346107670869155843/photo/1}; accessed July 27, 2021)), we could not find data for the City of Jabalpur.
Author: Ramaswamy et al.
source_population: Ramaswamy et al.: "As provided by JMC Jabalpur, the population of the city 12,06,219 "
source_deathsdata: Official death numbers obtained from the "Official Account of the Directorate of Health Services, Government of Madhya Pradesh. (e.g., "https://twitter.com/healthminmp/status/1346107670869155843/photo/1").  We multiplied the number recorded for 14 days after the end of the sampling window of 242 by a factor of 3.2 (based on the upper bound of \citet{mukherjee2021estimating}'s estimated  underreporting factor for Madhya Pradesh)  in order to account for potential underreporting.  As such, our interval is relatively wide and reflects the uncertainty in the true number of deaths: [237, 775].
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS}  (last updated 2021-03-19)).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for India from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {khan2021results}
Author: Khan et al.
source_population: Khan et al.: "We provide seroprevalence estimates in Kashmir, a valley in north India with a population of approximately 7.6 million."
source_deathsdata: Official death numbers obtained from the "Official Twitter handle of Department of Information and Public Relations, Govt of Jammu & Kashmir (DIPR-J&K "@diprjk")".  Note that, while not specifically referenced, the numbers reported by this source are consitent with those used in Khan et al. Unfortunately, \citet{mukherjee2021estimating} does not provide an estimated underreoprting factor for Kashmir noting that this is "[o]wing to lack of sufficient data, estimates from Jammu and Kashmir...".  As such, we exclude this study from the analysis.
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS}  (last updated 2021-03-19)).
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for India from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).  Note that we use 18.9 million as the estimated population of Delhi, the number cited by both \citet{sharma2020seroprevalence} and \citet{bhattacharyya2021incorporating}, while \citet{chen2021serological} use a much different number: 30,290,936 (see Table S14 in Supplementary appendix 2 of \citet{chen2021serological}).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {poustchi2021sars}
Notes_exclusion: No (excess) mortality data available for the specific target population (i.e., for the 18 specific Iranian cities).
Author: Poustchi et al.
source_deathsdata: \citet{kobak2021excess} suggest that official mortality data for Iran is innacurate.  Furthermore, city specific mortality data could not be found; however see Ghafari et al. (2021) for a provinve-level analysis of excess deaths associated with the Iranian COVID-19 epidemic.

Author: He et al.

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {qutob2021seroprevalence}
Notes_exclusion: The target population is the West Bank or more specifically ``the Palestinian population residing in the West Bank''.  \citet{karlinsky2021world} do not include the West Bank (or Palestine) in their analysis, so their excess death numbers are unavailable for us to determine if the official COVID-19 mortality numbers are accurate.
Author: Qutob et al.
source_population: Population value is from the CIA World Factbook (\url{https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/countries/west-bank/}; accessed July, 30, 2021).  This CIA World Factbook has a estimated population of ``2,949,246 (July 2021 est.)'' noting that ``approximately 418,600 Israeli settlers live in the West Bank (2018); approximately 215,900 Israeli settlers live in East Jerusalem (2017)''.
Country.or.Area: Palestinian population residing in the occupied Palestinian territory, including east Jerusalem
Specific.Geography: occupied Palestinian territory, including east Jerusalem
source_deathsdata: For Qutob et al., the target population is the West Bank or more specifically "the Palestinian population residing in the West Bank".  Karlinsky & Kobak (2020) do not include the West Bank (or Palestine) in their data, so we can't use excess death numbers to determine if official covid mortality numbers are accurate.  We use official death numbers from the palestinian government dashboard (https://corona.ps/details) (substrating those deaths listed for the Gaza Strip).
source_aged65data: Data for the proportion aged over 65 is from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (\url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS?locations=PS}; accessed July 30, 2021) for the West Bank and Gaza.
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for West Bank and Gaza from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).

Prevalence.Estimate.Name: {stefanelli2021prevalence}
Author: Stefanelli et al.
source_population: Stefanelli et al. : "Based on the census data, 7898 individuals resident in the municipalities were involved in the study (population on 1 January 2019; source: National Census Bureau, ISTAT)."
Location: Five municipalities of the Autonomous Province of Trento, Italy
source_deathsdata:
Death numbers obtained from archived versions of the COVID TRENTINO dashboard: https://covid19trentino.fbk.eu/ (for the five municipalities: "BORGO CHIESE" , "CAMPITELLO DI FASSA-CIAMPEDEL", "CANAZEI-CIANACEI" , "PIEVE DI BONO-PREZZO", "VERMIGLIO").  The dashboard notes that data corresponds to "total number of deceased persons residing in that municipality from 3 March 2020".   The github repository associated with the dashboard is at:
https://github.com/napo/covid19apssdashboard
If you click on the commits, you can find all the changes (https://github.com/napo/covid19apssdashboard/commits/master).  Thank you to Maurizio Napolitano for assistance with these data.  Note that Stefanelli et al.  write that "35 deaths were reported, since the beginning of the pandemic, in the five municipalities involved in the seroprevalence study"  and "35 deaths have been registered among elderly individuals during the study period."
source_aged65data: https://www.citypopulation.de/en/italy/admin/trentino_alto_adige/022__trento/
source_GDPdata: GDP value is from value listed for Italy from World Bank's World Development Indicators (WDI) data (see: \url{https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD} (last updated 2021-04-26)).
